greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) is the constant term in the expansion of ((Sum_{j=-n..n} x^j) * (Sum_{j=-n..n} y^j) - (Sum_{j=-n+1..n-1} x^j) * (Sum_{j=-n+1..n-1} y^j))^k.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of k-step closed paths (from origin to origin) in 2-dimensional lattice, using steps (t_1,t_2) (|t_1| + |t_2| = 2*n).
T(n,k) is the constant term in the expansion of (Sum_{j=0..2*n} (x^j + 1/x^j)*(y^(2*n-j) + 1/y^(2*n-j)) - x^(2*n) - 1/x^(2*n) - y^(2*n) - 1/y^(2*n))^k for n > 0.
formula: See the second code written in PARI.
program: T(n, k) = if(n==0, 1, sum(j=0, k, (-1)^(k-j)*binomial(k, j)*polcoef(f(n)^j*f(n-1)^(k-j), 0)^2))
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 03 2019
